title: Ticket #674: a request to retrieve a checkpoint somtimes stalls
description:
call dump from gdb on starter 
#0  0x0000003ff80c54f0 in __read_nocancel () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#1  0x00000000006e1c76 in Generic_read ()
#2  0x00000000006daec6 in __wrap_read ()
#3  0x00000000004d8d15 in get_file ()
#4  0x00000000004aab75 in UserProc::transfer_executable ()
#5  0x00000000004aafc9 in UserProc::fetch_ckpt ()
#6  0x00000000004a5da3 in get_exec ()
#7  0x00000000004df81e in StateMachine::execute ()
#8  0x00000000004a628d in main ()

We think that the socket that is opened for retrieving the checkpoint is not using KEEPALIVE, because netstat shows it connected on the starter side, and not even existing on the checkpoint server side, after days.

(ken and Dan B. looked at this together)
creator: khahn
